intro: Siagonarrhen subicanus, commonly known as the Philippine starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble the common starfruit. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree with glossy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white and fragrant, attracting various pollinators. The fruit, which is edible, has a distinctive star-like appearance when mature.
